author: Tom Harriss
comment: Why use codes anyway?   Why not let user set their own code as their email address?
title: Poor design.   Codes don't show up.

author: Jessica Bowman
comment: I can't find my code! The dev says to press "receive vibrations" and my code will appear, but all it says is "not connected." Cool idea but poorly executed, they didn't include instructions or any kind of help area.
title: Unusable

author: Shahin Fadakar
comment: Some things I noticed were that you have to wait at least a half minute for the button to actually react accordingly. If you try sending a vibration immediately after opening the app the button lags behind by a lot. Also wish you could change it from a foreground service to a background one. All in all, worth the download but hardly complete.
title: Pretty good

author: Temple Pate
comment: It keeps saying client ID not found. Please fix.. (Update) now all it is saying is not connected, when I am connected to the internet. Please fix!!
title: Great but.

author: David
comment: Enabling vibrations just gives a Not connected message. Could not get app to function with smartphone to smartphone and both connected to WiFi. Maybe dev's server is down. Also you can save a contact without entering a partner code, which isn't ideal.
title: Not connected

author: Diego Madrigali
comment: There is a need for an option to disable vibration on the phone.  Also, it would be great to be able to send vibrations directly from the watch.
title: Good. Features missing

author: Himmat Singh
comment: The app finally works now the code takes a little time to arrive. This app seems cool didn't test it out with another device yet

reply.author: Wearable Software
reply.content: Press the button receive vibrations. After that your Code will be shown at the bottom of the app. Please review again. Thanks.

title: Working

author: Darren Turbill
comment: ...of a broken app that is "Not Connected" not ever. What a waste of time.
title: 1000+ Downloads...

author: Jason Klein
comment: Can't get a code to give to my wife, useless
title: No code

author: Andrew Khoo
comment: Would be better if it shows my own code in a better way.
title: Could be better

author: Frank Mouwer
comment: Works great, would be awesome if you can send taps trough a website though
title: Website

author: Wesley Patrick
comment: I was hoping someone would emulate this feature on android soon. Was one of the features I actually liked from the Apple Watch. I really hope you can make it so that you can see the taps and and send emoji and your heart beat as well right from your watch to all of your contacts and not just one receiver code. :) EDIT: maybe you could add the feature to only vibrate the watch. When I tried it with my own code, it vibrated the phone too.

author: Tony Bombardo
comment: My partner received vibrations from me, but I only received one of the ones she sent. Not sure what's going on, we did everything right.  I'm using a nexus 5 and a moto 360, she's got a nexus 4

reply.author: Wearable Software
reply.content: Try out the new update. Because now, the partner code remains even after web disconnect. Please update your review. Thanks.

title: Cool, but doesn't work

author: Tanveer Huq
comment: My friend and I couldn't ever get it to connect. Would be exactly what I was looking for if it did.
title: Didn't get it to work
